macros.sourceContext:
|

When applied to anchor elements, the truncating can happen in the middle of the text, not necessarily at the end.

|
> |

Note: This property was originally implemented in WebKit and has some issues. It got standardized in CSS Overflow Module Level 4 for legacy support. The CSS Overflow Module Level 4 specification also defines a {{cssxref("line-clamp")}} property, which is meant to replace this property and avoid its issues.

^ |
|

Syntax

title: -webkit-line-clamp
summary: The -webkit-line-clamp CSS property allows limiting of the contents of a block to the specified number of lines.
